articles.title: S&P 500 (SPX) Opens Up or Down on February 23? Trading Odds & Predictions (Feb. 23, 2026)
articles.summary: Traders are betting on whether the S&P 500 will open higher or lower on February 23, 2026, with prediction markets offering live odds on the daily direction. These short-term market bets give traders a way to profit from overnight news cycles and pre-market volatility without holding actual positions in the index.

articles.title: Opinion | Minnesota must gather its wits about prediction markets
articles.summary: Minnesota lawmakers are apparently fumbling their approach to prediction markets regulation. If they botch this like other states have with sports betting rollouts, it could set back legal prediction markets nationwide and push more trading offshore.

articles.title: Brazil approves first prediction markets as financial securities
articles.summary: Brazil's financial regulators have officially classified prediction markets as legitimate securities, making it the first major Latin American economy to give the industry formal regulatory approval. This opens up a massive new market of 215 million people and could trigger a domino effect across other emerging economies that have been sitting on the sidelines.

articles.title: The rising threat of gambling in Utah | Opinion
articles.summary: Utah's famously strict anti-gambling laws are facing new pressure as betting expands nationwide and residents cross state lines to wager. If Utah's iron grip on gambling starts to crack, it opens the last major holdout state to legal betting markets and creates a massive new customer base for prediction platforms.

articles.title: TN Court Grants Kalshi’s Motion For Preliminary Injunction On Sports Predictions
articles.summary: A Tennessee court granted Kalshi's preliminary injunction request, likely allowing the prediction market platform to continue offering sports betting contracts while legal challenges play out. This ruling gives Kalshi breathing room to expand its sports markets and could set precedent for how courts treat prediction markets that blur the line with traditional sports betting.

articles.title: Gambling on the future? The crackdown on prediction markets, explained
articles.summary: Regulators are tightening the screws on prediction markets, treating them more like gambling than forecasting tools. The crackdown threatens to push these platforms underground or offshore, making it harder for Americans to bet on everything from elections to economic indicators.

articles.title: You Can Bet on It
articles.summary: Betting markets are expanding into new territories, letting people wager on everything from celebrity breakups to congressional votes. This flood of new betting options creates more opportunities for sharp bettors to find mispriced odds while giving prediction markets fresh data on public sentiment.

articles.title: Polymarket Bitcoin Price Prediction Says $75K, But Charts Don't
articles.summary: Polymarket traders are betting Bitcoin will hit $75,000 while technical analysis suggests the charts tell a different story. The disconnect highlights how prediction markets can diverge from traditional analysis methods, creating potential arbitrage opportunities for savvy bettors who can read both signals.

articles.title: The rise of Polymarket, the cryptocurrency-based betting site for current events
articles.summary: Polymarket has emerged as the dominant platform for betting on real-world events using cryptocurrency, from election outcomes to celebrity gossip. The platform's growth signals that crypto-native prediction markets are finally hitting mainstream adoption, potentially reshaping how we aggregate information about future events.

articles.title: Canada vs USA Olympic Men's Hockey Prediction: Best Odds at Prediction Markets like Kalshi
articles.summary: The prediction markets are pricing odds for the next Olympic men's hockey showdown between hockey's two biggest rivals, with both Canada and the USA entering as heavy favorites despite years of international parity. Smart money is watching these early lines closely since Olympic hockey futures historically offer better value than traditional sportsbooks, especially before roster announcements create major line movement.

articles.title: How many inches of snow in NYC this weekend? (February 21 - 23)
articles.summary: NYC faces a potential snow event this weekend, with meteorologists tracking a storm system that could dump anywhere from a dusting to several inches across the five boroughs. Weather bets are heating up on prediction platforms as traders position themselves on snowfall totals, while sportsbooks eye potential game postponements and under/over adjustments for outdoor events.
